title: Designing Scientific English Speaking Assessments in Online Learning Environments: Integrating Gagné’s Nine Events Theory and the Scientific Inquiry Process

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge in electrical engineering, experience in scientific experiment design and variable control, intermediate English conversational skills, and familiarity with basic scientific terminology
context.additional_context: VR simulation-based learning operating in BYOD environments. Learners can participate in real-time video conferences and submit asynchronous assignments via personal devices. Emphasizes training to express scientific inquiry processes (observation→hypothesis→experiment→analysis→conclusion) in English. Also evaluates experimental data visualization and graph interpretation skills

learning_goals: Learners explain electrical engineering experiment results in a 3-minute structured English presentation within VR simulations, incorporating variable control and evidence-based analysis
Learners write self-assessment reports reflecting peer feedback and experimental data, improving scientific English speaking proficiency (presentation structure, technical term accuracy) by ≥20%

Learners achieve scientific English fluency (1.5 seconds/word) equivalent to face-to-face classes in online settings through Gagné’s nine instructional events (hypothesis setting → experiment design → data analysis → conclusion)

resources: English-language resource set on electrical engineering topics

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
